availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph T. Berry (Barren County teacher and farmer)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, teacher and farmer. Kentucky native. Married Keziah E. Young Berry in 1852. Father of John T. Berry. Held nine slaves in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Division 1, p. 311. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Division 1, p. 139. Kentucky Birth, Marriage, and Death Records, 1852-1910, Marriages, Hart County, 1852. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Glasgow, District 2, p. 108. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, District 2, p. 21. Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registrations, 1863-1865, Ancestry, Kentucky, Third Congressional District, Barren County, 1864, p. 18. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Cave City, p. 12.
